utterance.speaker: Player
utterance.content: Over here, over here!

utterance.speaker: Player
utterance.content: Clear him, clear him!

utterance.speaker: Fan
utterance.content: Hey, what was that?

utterance.speaker: Fans
utterance.content: Hatchet, Hatchet, Hatchet!

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Nice to meet the pride of Trois-Rivieres. I still got your Wings rookie card.

utterance.speaker: Szabo
utterance.content: So what's that worth?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: It's a collector's item. They don't make them like you anymore.

utterance.speaker: Szabo
utterance.content: So do you wanna go?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Square up. Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Linesman
utterance.content: He didn't get a hand on you? You're going to be a force in the show.

utterance.speaker: Toros Fan
utterance.content: Whoo!

utterance.speaker: Spartans Fan
utterance.content: Boo!

utterance.speaker: Toros Fan
utterance.content: Come on, Toros!

utterance.speaker: Linesman
utterance.content: Get a trainer over here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Capacity crowd is on its feet. Five seconds on the clock. Ah. How is it possible for one man to be blessed with so much skill? Ahhh.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I had one just like this, except it was Bruins and the Habs. Where did you get it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Birthday present for someone in pediatric oncology. 22-year-old enforcer with hemoptysis.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's a hockey player?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, he's a superhero.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's coughing up blood because he probably broke a rib and punctured a lung while breaking someone else's rib and puncturing their lung in the name of sport.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice conclusion to which the E.R. already jumped 18 hours ago. Short man equals bullied child.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was average height as a kid and never bullied.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Until now. X-ray ruled out traumatic sequelae, overt TB, and lung cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis. Nodules could be too small to show up on an X-ray. Fighting's the best part of hockey. Without it, you've got the Ice Capades.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Fighting has nothing to do with hockey. It's like the cheerleaders at a basketball game.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cheerleading's the best part of basketball. Without it you've got… basketball.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's a duck hunter. He could've contracted psittacosis from exposure to fowl.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He had three teeth knocked out two weeks ago. Infection could've led to oral bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Not without continuing dental pain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then he took an elbow to the gut, which caused an esophageal tear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase, CT the patient. Check for sarcoid. Adams, sputum cultures and serologies for psittacosis. Taub… I'd tell you why I think your theory is not just wrong but ill-conceived, but it's more fun to prove it by having you check the stool for blood. And while we wait for the stool fairy, I'm a man down, so you want to drop your pants and hit the ice.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: The faster you guys can do this, the better. The NHL's been sniffing around, and being in the hospital is not really helping my marketability.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You have to be pretty good to get called up.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Yeah, leading the league in penalty minutes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And visits to the E.R., not counting the ones you've caused.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Not a hockey fan, I gather?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I am. That's the point. Fighting cheapens a great sport.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Oh, come on, that's like saying passing cheapens football. It's part of the game. I don't cause injuries.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They're self-inflicted?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: No, I prevent them. I take the hit so the smaller guys don't have to. I thought you'd appreciate that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Neighbor's baby again?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I could hear it through earplugs, two pillows, and three sleeping pills.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I just said, "hmm."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're trying to figure out some deeper significance to my having a couple of crappy nights.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which one of us is analyzing the word "hmm" here?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apology accepted. However…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not the crying that's keeping you awake. The sound of a needy child is stirring your paternal juices.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The sound of a needy child at 112 decibels has stirred my inner murderer. Don't mess with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Explain the stains on your shirt. You're lactating. The fact that you're the only fruit on your family tree is getting to you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's not a big deal. So I'll probably never be a dad. It's–it sucks. I'll lose a little sleep, but—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not supposed to feel bad when you dodge a bullet. It's like you got survivor's guilt.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There are actually things in this world that give life even more meaning than soap operas and monster trucks. And we happen to be missing out on at least one of them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Remember the falconer?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Beth?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You dated two falconers? Yes, Beth. The night the two of you split up, you came around to my place, wallowing in self-pity and tequila. You passed out. She called that night, asked me to give you a message. She said she was pregnant… Which, God and Planned Parenthood willing, means you are the father of an 11-year-old. I told you the next morning… hypothetically. I asked you how you'd feel if Beth had gotten pregnant, and you said, and I quote, "It would be the worst mistake of my life."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And… scene. Two performances Sunday, dark Mondays?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just as well.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I want to kill my mother. My Popo's on her own, and my mother always needs me to take care of her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, you could kill Popo instead.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I have to take her shopping, to her friends, to Atlantic City. I love her, but every night, every weekend…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And only if there was some solution, someplace where you could live… that's not there.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My mom would freak. It would be the ultimate sign of disrespect.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay. Then stay. And maybe you consider not bitching about it?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Not everyone's lucky enough to have your independence.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't worry. When you lose your family, you'll have it too.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He doesn't have sarcoid.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look at that.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That's his spleen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know. But he's gotten it supersized.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Deep vein thrombosis caused by any one of his many injuries or surgeries.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Leukemia's a better fit.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We have a guy who is punishing his body on a daily basis. Don't you think that's a more likely cause than cancer?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No, because she doesn't have an agenda.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that was incredibly unprofessional. Well, it was really Taub's fault. If you're not prepared to slam her into the boards, she's got no reason not to go after you. Might I suggest pulling her jersey over her head first?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We should get an ultrasound for DVT and WBC for leukemia.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: You think I could have cancer?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: More likely, it's just a DVT.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: This is my agent. I gotta get this, man. Give me some good news, Kenny. I thought you said any day. Okay. All right. I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I called Beth. I have an 11-year-old son.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Liver failure could alter hormone levels, cause abnormal breast development.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Alcoholism. We should search his home and locker room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Note that the person who wants to search the home didn't sleep in one last night. You have the imprint of a seatbelt buckle in your cheek.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I got in a fight with my mother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She hit you with a seatbelt?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be hemochromatosis.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Explains the liver and the spleen, but hemoptysis is a stretch. What about leptospirosis?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's a good fit, if you ignore the fact that he's a pro athlete who looks like the Incredible Hulk, which means he's gotta be on steroids, which is a better fit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All we really know for sure is it was his evil job that caused the problems.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, I don't like him. Doesn't mean my judgment's affected.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe. Let's take a look at the instant replay. This is the hit that precipitated Booby Orr's fight. Dirty or clean?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The hit was clean.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Really? The guy released the puck at least a second before the hit.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We have a difference of opinion. That's all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely. Maybe she's as biased as you. Or maybe the entire league is. After review, the league disciplinary commissioner ruled the hit illegal and dangerous and suspended the player for three games. Adams and Taub, run antibody titers for lepto. Chase and Park, check out the home, the locker room for booze, steroids, and Taub's objectivity.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: At least you're free. Going to get your own place?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If I can find a place I can afford, so… no.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you want, you can crash at my place in the spare bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That might be kind of weird.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I live in an apartment, not a dungeon.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's just two single people, opposite sex. I—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your bedroom door has a lock on the inside. Hey, if you prefer your car, be my guest.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Scrip for glanciclovir. If his neighbor has mono, could mean he has mono. If he has mono, explains his spleen and hemoptysis. And it's caused by Epstein-Barr virus, which explains his liver. And my moonroof leaks. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why don't we just assume that you're not the dad? Either you're the dad, or she cheated on you with your dad.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh! Sand art. I used to love this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's bitter, not mentally handicapped. Who knows what Beth told him about you? At worst, you're a rapist. At best, you're a rapist.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe she said I was a dead war hero.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Raised by a lunatic mother and abandoned by his father. Oh, I know! Squirrel handcuffs. You think he's gotten any of those?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you really wanted me to do nothing with this information, then why did you give it to me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you were pining for a kid, and you deserved to know that you already had one. But your parental cravings are more theoretical than applied. You want vicarious immortality more than you want a lifelong burden.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're assuming he's going to be a nightmare. What if he's a good kid?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's a kid. Best you can hope for is he's a nightmare.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, I'm not naive. I realize that this thing could go very badly, but the point is my son wants to meet me. And I want to meet him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Popo, I presume.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hey, uh, I let myself in. Um, this is—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We've met. I thought the whole point of this was to get away from Popo.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My dad's getting a cyst removed, and my mother had to take him to the clinic. Don't worry. She'll be gone in an hour.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not worried, because it's not my issue. She seems awfully quiet.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You haven't seen her drunk.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Bobby?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I found him crying in the fetal position.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's not a new symptom. He's crying because his liver failure threw his hormones out of whack.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Aside from the crying, he's actually recovering nicely.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Aside from the guy in the book depository, the Kennedys had a lovely trip to Dallas. Repetitive blows to the head can cause chronic traumatic encephalopathy, symptoms of which are aggressive behavior and depression.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So your theory is that his aggressive behavior caused his aggressive behavior. He's not depressed. He's just bummed because he knows he's a talentless moron who's only one lost fight away from being a barista. I understand that can get to a guy after a while.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If he quits being an enforcer, it could save his life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't want to save his life. You want to kill his career.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I moved into Chase's apartment. He knows. He was staring at our matching cups. I told you we should split up. We're not having sex. With each other…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yet.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I just mean no one knows the future right now, so we don't really know… The only conclusive test for CTE is post-mortem.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But an MRI of his brain could reveal white matter disintegrity, which is the effect of CTE.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why? Are you trying to sleep with her? 'Cause the simpler technique is just to ask.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was doing something nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mm, no. Th— mm. No, that doesn't fit.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's only had three concussions since he was ten. It's not enough to cause CTE.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Three reported concussions. These guys are taught in high school how to dupe the tests.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guilt?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This is really insulting.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not guilt. Park is a friend.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So it's guilt. Chase convinced you to leave mommy, and now he feels responsible. No MRI. Do a psych eval. If he doesn't start weeping again, send him home.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Duncan. Uh, James.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Uh, n-n-nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's nice to meet you. Um… How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good. I got you this.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's got three games built in, but you can download more from the website.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You already have one.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: I can always use a backup.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: Hi, can I start you with something to drink?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Just water, please.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: You got a Gamedeck? Way to go, Dad.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: According to your psych eval, the only thing happier than you is Disneyland.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: I'm sorry you had to see me like that last night. I'm just upset about being in the hospital and… I'm on some weird meds, but they must be working, because I'm feeling a lot better now.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Depression could be the symptom of a serious illness. CTE.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Yeah, my aunt sends me every article she can find on it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you know it could kill you.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: In the long run, like a lot of things.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You might be right. And an MRI could confirm that.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: I have enough evidence of head trauma in my file already, so…

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: My mom said you had trouble maintaining relationships with normal people. She also said you were a nice guy. I always figured she was lying 'cause she didn't want me to hate my deadbeat dad.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't know—

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: I-I know… now.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're a bright kid.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Thanks to you. Thanks to my mom, I'm also a big, soft-hearted wuss.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think you may have gotten that from both of us.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Uh, I gotta go, but it was really nice meeting you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It was nice meeting you, Duncan.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Uh, you want to hang out again?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Tonight?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Tonight? Well, I-I-there's, um… That would be great.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Okay. I'll text you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you. How did you talk him into it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He agreed once I promised him anonymity. Mr. and Mrs. Doe liked the name John apparently. Unfortunately we just wasted his time and proved House right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nothing? What about that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's an artifact.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's a density. I know you think I'm convincing myself, but this brain has been hammered for years, meaning evidence may be subtle, but it's there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Meaning you see what you want to see. Unless, of course, Chase is an idiot, and I do have brain damage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient's stroking out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase? Can you get me out of— Ohh… Hello?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The good news is, it's isolated ophthalmoplegia, which means you didn't have a stroke. Bad news is, Taub was right. You're still sick. I said "right," not "competent." Bursts your CTE bubble. You're going to need a whole new theory to keep Uncle Jesse and his Olsen twins on the bench.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Can we discuss my incompetence somewhere else?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Dr. House. Could I talk to you for a minute?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Could be neurosyphilis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's only 22.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And he's been on the road since he was 14.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So he was trash even before he was trash? You curious about what he wanted?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I assume he wanted me off the case, and you told him I was hit in the head as a child, and your mother made you promise to take care of me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He was doing what he always does — sticking up for the little guy. He told me to apologize to you, or he would… excrete down my throat. I'm paraphrasing. So if he should ask, I was a gentleman, or I will excrete down your throat.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Microscopic polyangiitis fits.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We should start plasmapheresis immediately.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to run an ANCA panel to confirm first. Putting him on plasmapheresis could make him bleed out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: MPA can progress quickly. We may not have time before it reaches his lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you're right. Thus confirming my objectivity. Start the treatment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Miserable yet?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He’s polite, well-adjusted and a straight-A student.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which means he doesn't need you. So why don't you get out while the butterfly effect is still in the cocoon stage?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm making him dinner.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't make an 11-year-old dinner. You give him a jar of peanut butter.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It'll be fine. I could give this kid a quinoa salad, and he would eat it just to be nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause he's a gutless placater, just like his dad.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is a terrible idea.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because we like each other?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. 'Cause of the statement "we like each other." You've known him 25 minutes. All you know about him is that he'd lie about a quinoa salad, whatever the hell that is.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're jealous of an 11-year-old because you are an 11-year-old.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So tell me about yourself. I mean, you're smart, you're nice, but what else?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: I don't know. I'm a kid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Right. What are you looking for?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You want… peanut butter?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Do you have prosciutto?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You like prosciutto?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: I'm weird.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, no. I-I like it too. I've got some in the fridge.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: How about goat cheese?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I love goat cheese.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think that was the best pizza I ever had.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think that was the best pizza I ever had.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: It was the hint of Dijon.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Do you have any aunts or uncles or grandparents?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: My mom got into some stupid fight with my grandfather. They all kind of cut us off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmmph.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Are you talking to your parents?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, and they're going to be very surprised and excited to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: That's awesome.

utterance.speaker: GPS Voice
utterance.content: You have arrived at your destination.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well—

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Thanks for the pizza.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sure, sure. It was, uh— I mean, it was great to spend time with you and—

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: I love you, Dad.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Can't be easy doing what you do. I mean, do you love it? Is it fun? I had my own plastic surgery practice making lots of money, but I wasn't happy. It wasn't what I went to med school for.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Every winter my dad would flood the backyard and made a rink. I was Lemieux. My little brother was Gretzky. I was good. I won the NDHA scoring title three years in a row. I kept getting bigger and stronger and better… ’til I didn't. My Juniors coach told me that, if I wanted to stay on the team, then I'd have to use my size. Every game, I got less and less ice time until it was all fighting and no hockey. I, uh… There's something going on with my arms. I can't feel them. I— Doctor, I can't feel my arms.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient's arms are now paralyzed. ANCA panel was negative. It's not MPA.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Lyme disease could cause paralysis. If he was hunting, he'd be exposed to ticks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No target rash or cardiac involvement. Roomies with benefits keeping you up?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cribbage. I played with Park's Popo.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that two separate events?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Grandmother. ALS could explain the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Sensory involvement rules out ALS.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. Now this is interesting. We'll get back to the patient in a second. Your issue is the same as Wilson's, except… you're haunted by the pitter-patter of tiny skanks. You don't feel guilty about getting Park thrown out of her home. You feel guilty about all the women that you've screwed over. My mother needs 1,000 bucks for snow tires.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Park's a friend. Popo's fun.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Paralysis has gone from his face to his arms, meaning it's descending, which is the hallmark of botulism.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So it was something he ate. How innocuous. You've overcome your bias by reversing it. The only problem is that being in love with a patient is just as judgmental as being in hate. We didn't find any contaminated—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No contaminated food. I'm not an idiot. But what if it's not from ingesting but from injecting? He was treated for intractable muscle spasms by the team's trainers. Sometimes they use botox.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We need to start the antitoxin—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The antitoxin could cause anaphylaxis. We need to test first to confirm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As if to prove my point, last time you said there wasn't enough time to test prior to a more dangerous treatment.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's a different situation, different symptom, different diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Different emotion. Give him the antitoxin.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No adverse effects.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Chase let me move in with him to get away from my grandmother. Then he practically let my grandmother move in with the both of us. He's being way more than nice.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then which answer is it? Chase feels guilty for pushing you to move out?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He didn't push me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Guilt about skanks.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He loves skanks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not the other option.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: There are people that like me. People even want to sleep with me. Some of them are even good-looking.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That good-looking? Did you see that? You're feeling something?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I could give you crap for making me wait 11 years, but instead I'm going to thank you for not making me wait another 11.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Every little girl wants a pony till they have to clean up after it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think I'm going to quit on this? On an 11-year-old?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The only relationship you haven't quit on has been with me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmm. A needy, truculent narcissist. I think it's been perfect training for parenthood.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's not even close. This is the rest of your life. You screw this up, you don't get to run away. You get to ruin both your lives. This is a bigger responsibility than any you've ever taken on and screwed up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I know. That's why I'm so excited about it.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: You're really happier doing this than looking at boobs all day?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Luckily I get patients like you every now and again who let me reexperience the joy.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: You know, the best part of my day is when I'm sitting in that penalty box after I beat someone up. That's the only time I know I'm safe. Think Lemieux ever felt that way? I'm not going back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: To hockey?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: To enforcing… whatever that costs.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good for you. Ooh! First goal for the pocket rocket. Bobby? We need a team in here!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's completely paralyzed, and he tested negative for botulism.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am now accepting long shots.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Polio. Some kids were never vaccinated.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Unless they played sports all their lives and had two physicals a year.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: How about MLD?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's a bad fit. I say that not because there's no treatment for MLD but because it's a bad fit. His cognitive abilities are unaffected.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Prion disease could explain the waxing and waning symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The test for Prions is a brain biopsy. Given his history, there's got to be brain swelling. We can't risk drilling into his skull.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty sure we can.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We also could keep talking until we can find an answer we all can agree on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All of us? Those who love him, those who hate him, those who don't give a crap about him or you—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or I could just discuss it on my own with Foreman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not your friend.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I get it. He's a patient. I'm not—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He never had your back. He didn't insist that I apologize to you. He asked me to take you off the case. Biopsy his brain.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Hey, Dad.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late. Got in a fight with my mom. She's such a tool.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm sure she means well.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: She wants to open a reserve in Costa Rica for rescued birds of prey.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But how serious is she? From my recollection, she used to talk about doing a lot—

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Yeah, but she bought plane tickets for Monday.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, Costa Rica is beautiful. And the schools are supposed to be great.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Oh, I'm not going. It's her stupid dream, not mine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then what will you do?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Uh… I-I thought maybe I could, uh… Maybe I could stay with you? Uh, y-your place is only 3 miles away from my school. I could bus it every day. And I do my own laundry. I keep my room tidy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Duncan, th-this-this is very sudden.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: I know. I'm sorry. Please don't send me to the jungle.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If it's okay with your mother, it's okay with me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Take me off the case. I've obviously completely lost my objectivity. I'm not helping, I'm not even neutral.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Agreed. So why shouldn't I take you off all my cases?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Because you were right. I hate bullies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You work for me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're not a bully.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty sure I am, dickwad.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've known a lot of bullies — people who didn't like me because I'm short, people who didn't like me because I'm Jewish—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I get it. There's a long list of reasons not to like you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You relentlessly mock, but it's not for self-aggrandizement. It's because ideas are bigger than feelings. At least that's what I choose to believe. I also thought you had the side effect of desensitizing me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You little Hebe. Here's some ideas for you. You screwed up. You kept on screwing up. Everything you said is true, except… it doesn't mean you walk away. You just learn to trust nothing. Everything you think you feel, everything you think you know. Question every call, play through every whistle.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I just had a light bulb. Maybe.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can trust light bulbs.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Stop. It's not prions. Epstein-Barr gave him mono. It also gave him Miller Fisher syndrome. The plasmapheresis played through the whistle. We gave it to him for MPA, but when he got worse, we took him off. When he got better, we thought it was the antitoxin. But it was actually the plasmapheresis still working. We had the right treatment, just the wrong diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was my metaphor that solved the case. Put him back on plasmapheresis. He'll be fine. Nice save. Didn't quite make up for being a sieve the rest of the game.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ex-girlfriend's baby again?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: His mother is moving to Costa Rica. He asked if he could move in with me. And I said yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, it's only six or seven years. Unless he can't get into college, in which case, it's more a matter of your life expectancy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I said yes, knowing I'm not remotely ready for that, knowing he's not ready to be separated from his mother. This isn't the act of a mature, rational adult. I-I can't do this, House. You were right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have an idea… that can make this entire problem go away.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, I really want to hear your clever late-term abortion joke. You were right about everything. This is life. It's real. It doesn't just go away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: None of that is true.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Duncan.

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Actually… Wendel. One "l." If you're going to get pissy, remember, it was House's idea.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're an actor?

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Five commercials and a recurring on Days of Our Lives.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were regretting not having kids, so I gave you one… thereby rendering you regret-free. It's a priceless gift.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, it's not priceless 'cause he charges SAG minimum.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Get out!

utterance.speaker: Duncan
utterance.content: Chillax, Dad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you do an Australian accent?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: I just got the call. Three-year deal. $2.1 million.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about the flooded backyard and pretending to be Lemieux?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: That's why I took it. After all I did to get here, half a dream is better than nothing. Maybe my new coach will see what my Juniors coach didn't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That'd be nice.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not sleeping with you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's a shame.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This is about Popo.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's not sleeping with me either, right?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You were jealous of me. My family.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe you've got too much, and I've got too little.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I might sleep with you after all.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The woman that I called — that was really Beth?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Found her on Facebook.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How much did she charge?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing. She's still pissed at you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pass the bacon.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I thought you liked prosciutto.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nobody likes prosciutto.
